issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Metrics landing page, see attached screenshot:

* Actions menu in table view hides behind edge of table
* grab bar to drag bottom of table longer needs a visible handle to distinguish it from 1px HR elsewhere in the table. There's no visual affordance to the user to show this is grabbale/draggable unless you hover over it
fields.summary: metrics landing page issues: actions dropdown hides behind table, drag bar needs better styling

comments.body: Could you detail what the grab handle should look like?

We can work on it together, depending on what you can do. One good way is to have a small rectangle that overlays the line, centered, like (rectangle would have full border, it's only broken for ASCII drawing purposes):
-------[      ]-------

or if that is too hard to do, you can put an indicator that it's grabbable underneath, like (asterisks are only for ASCII drawing purposes, we'd probably want to use more like very small $hpe-lightgray cubes):

-----------------------
         * * *

See what I am driving at? ETA: ugh, jira janked my beautiful ascii drawings when it saved my comment. attaching screenshot because Jira won't get the best of me!

[~jloza], I have a grab-handle w/ square, which I hope is nicer.
The action menus will be limited by this being in a scroll pane, so I can't just raise it above the surrounding stuff because it's scrolled out of view. I click an action menu that is partially hidden and can then scroll to make it fully visible. Not idea, but it works. Attaching screen shot of grab handle. Should I put this in for review?

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1923
hi [~dkavanagh], getting there! Can you make the square a bit wider, more of a rectangle? And can it overlay the HR so that the HR doesn't show through?
[~jloza], how's that one? (new screenshot attached) If the X axis stretch isn't good, I could just come up with some custom SVG for that instead.
hi [~dkavanagh], that looks better! Can you make it the same gray as the HR (it looks darker)?

Fix does not address issue regarding actions menu.

Grab bar looks good though!
Correct, did you see my comments about our ability to fix the menus and the workaround?

ah, I see your comment now, [~dkavanagh]. Yeah, we ned to find a way to fix that, having it underneath is not going to be a good thing. Can you have it pop up so the right side of the menu is aligned with the icon? That way it should always be visible.

OIC, yes, It seems to do that in chrome for some reason. I wasn't seeing that in FF. I'll see if I can fix that and get it to you for review.
oh yay, known issue: https://github.com/zurb/foundation-sites/issues/4619 that has caused many people to have a cow. Linked to another issue at the bottom where it says it's fixed in foundation 6.2. I'll look at some workarounds.

sigh, nothing yet, but at least chrome lets you scroll right to see the menu fully!
Yay, [~dkavanagh]! UX review passed, ready for code review.
[~dkavanagh]: The actions menu is cut off in Safari, although the horizontal scroll bar expands to allow access to the full menu.  Is that a known issue?

I tested on Safari (9.1), Chrome and FF and it looked fine on all
I did more testing and found it only hides it if safari is expanded fairly wide. I keep finding mark-share numbers all over the map. Not sure we should worry to much about this in any case. 
I see this if FF is made wider also. We really need newer Foundation to fix this.
Sorry for so many updates to this comment! Let me explain the problem. Foundation decides which side to put the menu on itself. The fix I put in for Chrome shifts things left since it was consistently being shown on the right side. For Safari and FF, the menu can be on either side and there's no way to conditionally shift it based on how Foundation decided to render it. Foundation fixed this by allowing me to override it's behavior in 6.2 (I think, but it's in the link above). I suggest we not do more about this for 4.3 and look at updating to the latest foundation for 5.0. I'll add that to our doc.
[~dkavanagh]: Let's open a separate ticket for the cut off actions menu bug on Safari/FF, as we'll probably need to mark that as a known issue for 4.3.
PR 1923 merged

Still observing menu cutoff in Firefox, tested on FF 47.0 on OS X Yosemite.  Screenshot attached.

Tested on: Chrome (incognito mode) Version 51.0.2704.84 (64-bit) - looks good there
Tested on: Safari 9.1.1 on OS X Yosemite - looks good there
Tested on: IE 11 on Windows 8.1 (Version 11.0.9600.18321) - looks good there
Tested on: Firefox 47.0 on OS X - issue persists there
Tested on: shared setup (region-one) - https://g-05-03.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Release: 0.9457.190.git97745f1.el7
@kamalgill, see my comments from April 28th. That's how it's going to have to be.
[~dkavanagh]: Ok, we should either mark this ticket as a known issue, or we could open a separate ticket (noting it only affects Firefox) and mark that as a known issue.
[~kgill] and [~dkavanagh]: this is currently in the Release Notes 4.3 as a KI. It states it only affects Firefox. Shall I remove it or leave it in the Release Notes?
[~tvo], it is still an issue, so I think it should stay.
